titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Miscellaneous Financial Materials Concerning Power Companies Operating in the North American West
Miscellaneous Financial Materials Concerning Power Companies Operating in the North American West
titlestmt.author: by Ellen Ellickson and Caroline Wilcox Reul

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 05:08

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous financial materials concerning power companies operating in the North American West

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: This collection, compiled by William H. Brown, contains a variety of financial documents concerning power companies operating in the North American West. Examples of these documents include company correspondence, letters and notices to the stockholders, maps, company profiles and charters, booklets of photographs, press releases, newspaper clippings, earnings statements, balance sheets, prospectuses, reports to the stockholders, proxy statements, stock and bond offerings, applications to the Securities and Exchange Commission, trust and mortgage indentures, protective and consolidation agreements, subscription agreements, legal briefs and other court documents. While all of these documents are represented in the collection, they are not all represented by each company.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Most of these financial materials were part of a collection acquired by Yale in 1922 from William H. Brown of West Haven, Conn. The collection, initially called the William H. Brown Statistical Library, numbered some 23,000 documents and covered the years 1890 to 1917. The collection was merged with similar materials already in the University Library and later expanded by gifts from Brown and others to become what is now known as the William H. Brown Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection, compiled by William H. Brown, contains a variety of financial documents concerning power companies operating in the North American West. Examples of these documents include company correspondence, letters and notices to the stockholders, maps, company profiles and charters, booklets of photographs, press releases, newspaper clippings, earnings statements, balance sheets, prospectuses, reports to the stockholders, proxy statements, stock and bond offerings, applications to the Securities and Exchange Commission, trust and mortgage indentures, protective and consolidation agreements, subscription agreements, legal briefs and other court documents. While all of these documents are represented in the collection, they are not all represented by each company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged first by region, i.e. Canada and the United States, and then alphabetically by company name.

did.unittitle: Billings and Eastern Montana Power Company
Central Iowa Power and Light Company
Iowa Light, Heat and Power Company
Kansas City Light and Power Company
Kansas City Power and Light Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Duluth Edison Electric Company.

did.unittitle: Omaha Electric Light and Power Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Pacific Light & Power Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Portland Railway, Light and Power Company and the Portland Electric Power Company.

did.unittitle: Sierra and San Francisco Power Company
Union Electric Light and Power Company (St. Louis, Missouri)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a pamphlet on the Bagnell Dam.

did.unittitle: Union Electric Light and Power Company of Illinois

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes one small and two large booklets of photographs.
